title: Sunny memories of foreign lands /
author: Stowe, Harriet Beecher
snippet: Still, I long for the full advent of our American day ofart, already dawning auspiciously. After finishing our inspection, -wte went back to StaffordHouse to lunch. In the evening we went to Lord John Russell's.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: We sat with the old lady (who is unable toleave her chair) in her room upstairs. Mrs Thurston toldme she used often to come in the old days to StaffordHouse, and recalled my dear mother there and at Windsor. To-day, a bitterly cold one, I called on Argyll at CampdenHill, and had a tite-d-tete luncheon with him.

title: Our coaching trip,
author: Carnegie, Andrew
snippet: Extremes meet. It was from houses such as Ihave spoken of that we went direct to StaffordHouse, to meet the Marquis of Stafford by appointment, and to be shown over that palace by him. What a change ! If the former were not up to ourexpectations, this exceeded them.
